meanings.definition: To make a photocopy using a xerographic copier.
meanings.sent1: She xeroxes important documents for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He xeroxes the report before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The office cat accidentally xeroxes its paw on the copy machine.
meanings.sent4: His memory xeroxes the image of her smile.
meanings.sent5: The copier xeroxes the paper with precision.

meanings.definition: A photocopy made using a xerographic copier.
meanings.sent1: I need to make several xeroxes of this document.
meanings.sent2: The file cabinet is full of xeroxes of old receipts.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's cat knocked over a stack of xeroxes during class.
meanings.sent4: Her mind is a collection of xeroxes of past experiences.
meanings.sent5: The xeroxes of the contract were distributed to all departments.
